intro: Sida brachystemon, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial species characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Sida brachystemon is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural and natural settings.
